profileAlternative.name: Krishnaiyengar Karthik
profileAlternative.headline: Data Scientist at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
profileAlternative.summary:
I graduated from New York University with a PhD in experimental particle physics. I am deeply passionate about the science of data analysis. My dissertation involved analyzing data collected by the ATLAS detector at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN

Over the course of my PhD I have developed a combination of analytic, computational and leadership skills with my main expertise being analysis of large datasets, statistical inference and model building.

I would like to use the computational and analytic skills I developed and apply them to solve problems in industry. I recently finished a data science fellowship with Insight Data Science where I built Goodreviews

items: Flux Discharge Cascades in Various Dimensions
Search for exotic Higgs-boson decays in events with at least one photon, missing transverse momentum, and two forward jets produced in $\sqrt{s}$ = 8 TeV $pp$ collisions with the ATLAS detector
